sections.body:
Welcome to Learning Hiragana Japanese Characters.

Basic Vowels.  Japanese has 5 basic vowels:
あ - a - pronounced "ah", like the vowel in "car"
い - i - pronounced "ee", like "bee" or "key"
 う - u - pronounced "u", like in "moo" or "tube"
え - e - pronounced "eh", like in "end" or "bet"
お - o - pronounced "oh", like in "joe" or "go"


あい (ai) is the Japanese word for "love".

sections.prompt:
Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

あ

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

い

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

う

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

え

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

お

sections.body:
Consonant sounds are combined with the basic vowels to make more characters.

"K" characters:
か - ka - pronounced "kah"
き - ki - pronounced "key"
く - ku - pronounced "coo"
け - ke - as in "okay"
こ - ko - as in "coal"

かく (kaku) is the Japanese word for "write"

sections.prompt:
Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

か

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

き

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:

く

Match the Japanese character with the sound it makes:
